solution_line_template: There are a total of {front_parking_spaces} + {back_parking_spaces} = <<{front_parking_spaces}+{back_parking_spaces}={total_parking_spaces}>>{total_parking_spaces} parking spaces in the school.

Since half of the spaces are filled then, {back_parking_spaces} x {back_spaces_filled_fraction} = <<{back_parking_spaces}*{back_spaces_filled_fraction}={cars_parked_back}>>{cars_parked_back} cars have parked at the back.
So, a total of {cars_parked_front} + {cars_parked_back} = <<{cars_parked_front}+{cars_parked_back}={total_cars_parked}>>{total_cars_parked} cars have parked in the school.
Therefore, {total_parking_spaces} - {total_cars_parked} = <<{total_parking_spaces}-{total_cars_parked}={available_parking_spaces}>>{available_parking_spaces} parking spaces are still available.
